| Origin                  = The team started with the remainders of the New Mutants under the leadership of Cable as a more militaristic force to assist mutants.
| PlaceOfFormation        = [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|Xavier Institute for Higher Learning]], [[Westchester County]], [[New York (State)|New York]]
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 
| Creators                = Fabian Nicieza; Rob Liefeld
| First                   = New Mutants #100
| Last                    = 

| HistoryText             = 
===Formation===
X-Force was born from the team known as the [[New Mutants (Earth-616)|New Mutants]] and created by the [[Homo Superior|mutant]] known as [[Nathan Summers (Earth-616)|Cable]]. After most of the New Mutants went their separate ways, Cable reorganized the team, which originally consisted of the [[Samuel Guthrie (Earth-616)|Cannonball]], [[Tabitha Smith (Earth-616)|Boom-Boom]], [[James Proudstar (Earth-616)|Warpath]], [[Gaveedra Seven (Mojoverse)|Shatterstar]], [[Maria Callasantos (Earth-616)|Feral]], and ''[[Neena Thurman (Earth-616)|Domino]]'' (Later revealed to actually be the shapeshifter, [[Vanessa Carlysle (Earth-616)|Copycat]]).{{r|New Mutants Vol 1 100}}

Where the other X-teams believed in protecting humans from evil mutants, X-Force adopted a proactive attitude towards mutant terrorists. Cable's basic philosophy, which he related to his team, was "Get them before they get you".  X-Force was involved in attacks on mutant groups such as the [[Mutant Liberation Front (Earth-616)|Mutant Liberation Front]] and was itself branded early in its career as a group of terrorists.{{r|X-Force Vol 1 1}}

[[Theresa Cassidy (Earth-616)|Siryn]] and [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Spider-Man]] aided the team when [[Thomas Cassidy (Earth-616)|Black Tom]] and the [[Cain Marko (Earth-616)|Juggernaut]] attempted to bomb the World Trade Center in [[New York City|New York]] and Siryn remained with the team.{{r|X-Force Vol 1 3|4}}

When Cable's clone, [[Nathan Summers (Stryfe) (Earth-4935)|Stryfe]], made an assassination attempt on [[Charles Xavier (Earth-616)|Professor Charles Xavier]], he was in the guise of Cable.  Assuming Cable was the assassin, [[X-Factor (Government) (Earth-616)|X-Factor]] and the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] hunted X-Force. A fight ensued and X-Force was defeated. X-Force's members were taken prisoner and locked up in the X-Men's [[Danger Room]] for a time.  They were later released after learning that they had no idea of the whereabouts of Cable and that they could help with the search for the Mutant Liberation Front.{{citation}}

X-Force continued its status as an outlaw band of mutants, dodging both their enemies and the government agents of [[Operation: Zero Tolerance]].{{citation}}

===Disbanding and [[X-Corporation (Earth-616)|X-Corporation]]===
X-Force recruited [[Peter Wisdom (Earth-616)|Pete Wisdom]] to train them for a time.  X-Force apparently disbanded shortly after the new team that would eventually be known as the [[X-Statix (Earth-616)|X-Statix]] swiped their name without permission.  Several former members went on to join Professor Xavier's [[X-Corporation (Earth-616)|X-Corporation]].{{citation}} 

===[[X-Force (Strike Team) (Earth-616)|Black Ops X-Force]]===
When the first new mutant baby was born since M-Day, [[Scott Summers (Earth-616)|Cyclops]] ordered the reforming of X-Force. Wolverine led the team to hunt down Cable and the new born mutant. Later, Cyclops secretly organized a new [[X-Force (Strike Team) (Earth-616)|X-Force]], with all of the best trackers at his disposal.{{r|Uncanny X-Men #493}} This team operated with a similar philosophy as the old one, that of targeting potential threats before they had the chance to become dangerous. Instead of simply targeting evil mutants however, this incarnation of X-Force targeted any potential threat to mutantkind. {{citation}}

The team was disbanded by Cyclops after its existence came to light, and after [[Hope Summers (Earth-616)|Hope Summers]] returned to the present. However, Wolverine secretly continued to run X-Force with several new members, all of whom were hardened killers. This incarnation of the team was eventually disbanded as well, after Wolverine killed [[Akihiro (Earth-616)|his own son]]. {{citation}}

===Cable and X-Force===
After returning from the [[Earth-80521|future]], [[Nathan Summers (Earth-616)|Cable]] began hunting down members of the [[Avengers (Earth-616)|Avengers]] he believed posed a threat to [[Hope Summers (Earth-616)|Hope Summers]]. Racing against time, Cable tried desperately to assassinate the Avengers before the [[Techno-Organic Virus]] overtook his body. He was stopped by Cyclops and Hope, who was able to completely heal him with the [[Phoenix Force (Earth-616)|Phoenix Force]], but also put him into a healing coma.{{r|Avengers: X-Sanction #1|#4}}

Cable was brought to [[Utopia (X-Men Base)|Utopia]] to heal,{{r|Avengers: X-Sanction #4}} but during the [[Phoenix Five (Earth-616)|Phoenix Five's]] battle with the Avengers, he left unnoticed.{{r|AvX: Consequences #1}} He then sought out [[Forge (Earth-616)|Forge]] in [[China]] to help him.{{r|Marvel NOW! Point One #1}} He later recruited [[James Bradley (Earth-616)|Doctor Nemesis]], [[Neena Thurman (Earth-616)|Domino]] and [[Piotr Rasputin (Earth-616)|Colossus]] to reform his vigilante X-Force. As a side-effect of being cured of the techno-organic virus, Cable was having visions of the future, and assembled the team to help him stop all the disasters he foresaw.{{r|Cable and X-Force #1}}

===X-Force Return=== 
After the disbandment of his previous team, and the "Alexandria Incident", an attack on a defence symposium in the city of Alexandria, an incident tied to a mutant, Cable decided to create a black ops team to protect the interests of the mutant "nation". To this end, he recruited [[Elizabeth Braddock (Earth-616)|Psylocke]], [[Doctor Nemesis]], [[Fantomex]] and [[Marrow (Sarah) (Earth-616)|Marrow]].{{citation}}

===The Originals Return===
After their former leader was killed by a younger version of himself, Domino and the rest of the original team got back together in order to exact justice by finding the younger Cable. They managed to find him and [[Deathlok Prime (Earth-10511)|Deathlok]] in the country of [[East Transia]] where they thought he was supplying futuristic weapons to the Transian government.{{r|X-Force Vol 5 1}}

| Notes                   = * X-Force co-creator [[Rob Liefeld]] has expressed that the team was created to contrast the "mopey group" that the X-Men had become at the time, and it was envisioned as a much a more aggressive arm of the X-Men. He believed that "somewhere between Xavier's pacifists views and Magneto's terrorist views there had to be an activist view."{{r|{{cite web|url=https://www.fandango.com/amp/movie-news/get-deadpool-tickets-now-plus-how-you-can-snag-this-exclusive-poster-from-deadpool-creator-rob-liefeld-753151|title=Get 'Deadpool' Tickets Now, Plus: How You Can Snag This Exclusive Poster from 'Deadpool' Creator Rob Liefeld|work=Fandango|first=Erik|last=Davis|date=19 April 2018|accessdate=23 April 2018}}}}
